poem:
In Memory of Four

Darkness found its mark,  
four voices silenced, untold.  
Stars engraved in Colchester's heart,  
prophecies of youth unfold.

In shadow's grip, dreams unspun,  
courts lay empty, echoes fade.  
Threads of their laughter bravely spun,  
etching in memory, their cascade.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. All four were students at University of Essex and three were keen basketball players.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
